name: comparison
content:
Gets the result of an expression that compares two values.

This block determines if the comparison of two values is true. For example, the comparison expression 3 < 4 is true, while the expression 3 > 4 is false. This block should only be used in other logic blocks.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: This fish is only afraid of bears whose size is greater than 90. Press space to make a bear appear and see what the fish does.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: Click on the gold coin, and the green critter will guess a random number between 1 and 25. If the green critter guesses a number that is higher than the one the princess critter was thinking of, he will get her gold coin!

palette_params.name: value 1
palette_params.description: Variable, number, color, text, or logic block to be compared with value 2

palette_params.name: operator
palette_params.description: Allows the two values to be compared: = ≠ < ≤ >≥

palette_params.name: value 2
palette_params.description: Variable, number, color, text, or logic block to be compared with value 1

short_description: Returns true or false after evaluating an expression that compares two values.
